Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have tender bumps on my shins that have been there for about 3 months.
Have these bumps changed in size or color since they first appeared?
No, they have not changed in size or color since they first appeared.
Do you have any other symptoms like joint pain, abdominal pain, or eye problems?
No, I do not have any joint pain, abdominal pain, or eye problems.

I was found to be positive for hepatitis B four months ago, but I do not have diabetes or an autoimmune disease.
Have any of your close family members had similar skin issues or a history of hepatitis B?
No, none of my close family members have had similar skin issues or a history of hepatitis B.
**Final Diagnosis:** Erythema nodosum.
